fields.description:
I want raw url to my bitbucket repo, but when I navigate to it, it shows dead link. src url works fine. Here is the raw url for my repo - https://bitbucket.org/k3jignesh/hibernate-pojos/raw/master/repository/

What's wrong here? How to get raw url for your bitbucket repo?
fields.summary: Raw URL to repo is dead, but src url works fine

fields.description:
Right now I don't see a way of programmatically accessing Pipelines. It wold be very useful if pipeline operations were exposed in REST API. These operations could include:

* GET a list of pipeline runs (along with results, etc)
* POST a request to run pipeline for specific commit or branch
* cancel (DELETE) a running pipeline

It would enable such scenarios as: invoking pipeline from command line, pipeline status monitoring, etc. An example of a similar API is [AppVeyor's builds API|https://www.appveyor.com/docs/api/projects-builds#start-build-of-branch-most-recent-commit]
fields.summary: Add pipelines endpoint to REST API

fields.description:
Hi,\\
Is there anyone knows why I'm getting above mentioned error? Couple of days back it was working absolutely fine, But suddenly its showing "SecureTransport error: I/O error (bummers) (-1)"  error message  while pushing from Xcode.
fields.summary: SecureTransport error: I/O error (bummers) (-1)

fields.description: Many test setups allow you to generate reports such as coverage reports or auto generated documentation, would be nice to be able to view these assets after a test run.
fields.summary: Provide a way to store / view artifacts / assets generated by test run

fields.description: My phone became unavailable due to a battery fault. I had to reset my 2FA settings to get access to bit bucket again.  There is no support toads a second 2FA device.  Having the (near) single point of failure is problematic.
fields.summary: Please allow multiple 2Factor Authentication devices.

fields.description:
Previously, you could choose which email address was the default one to send the notifications to. I had two email addresses tied to my BitBucket account, private one and work one. Work email address was the default one.

Now that my BitBucket account was migrated to my private Atlassian Account, work related repo notifications are sent to my private email address instead of the work one.

It should be possible to add an alternate notification email address.
fields.summary: Allow notifications to be sent to email address different from Atlassian account email

fields.description:
I found that your importer allows import of Git and Mercurial repositories, but the target repository is fixed.

I know BitBucket supports both Git and Mercurial repositories, but I no longer want to use the Mercurial tools, so I want to migrate my Mercurial repositories to Git.

Please add support for this use case.
fields.summary: Cannot use Importer to migrate a Mercurial repository into a Git repository.

fields.description:
The post comment on a commit/pull request [API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/changesets%2BResource#changesetsResource-POSTanewcommentonachangeset] does not work when the line_to parameter is pointing to a white line.

Recent activity will show that a comment is added, but the comment is nowhere to be seen.

line_from parameter works correctly on a white line.
fields.summary: Post comment on a commit/pull request API does not work when line_to parameter points to a white line

fields.description: In a pull request that has multiple heads (some of them closed), our merge code seems to choose the wrong one.
fields.summary: Bitbucket sometimes chooses the wrong Mercurial branch head

fields.description:
Assuming that the PR has a file "application/libraries/application/Entity/Project.php"\\
Sending this request works fine

curl -u "user:pass" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '\\
{ "content" : "Test Comment", "line_from": 136, "filename" : "application/libraries/application/Entity/Project.php" }\\
' https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/user/repo/pullrequests/338/comments

Sending this request breaks the PR in the manner described.\\
curl -u "user:pass" -H "Content-Type: application/json" -d '\\
{ "content" : "Test Comment", "line_from": 136, "filename" : "/application/libraries/application/Entity/Project.php" }\\
' https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/user/repo/pullrequests/338/comments

The only difference between those two calls is whether I am sending an absolute path or a relative path. (When the original requests we being sent, they weren't simply a stray slash, it was a full path on my machine).
fields.summary: API 1 Requests Break Activity (BB-16199)

fields.description:
It would be great if on creating a pull request one could review the related issues in Jira. Since the Pull Request is showing the related issues already, a button to show those issues in a flat list in Jira would be great.\\
This would help to bulk edit those issues in Jira, for example to add a fixVersion or a resolution status.\\
Since the pull request shows what "really goes" onto a branch.
fields.summary: Ability to open all related issues in Jira

fields.description: Image demonstrating the issue is attached, the issues is that the names in the source and target branch dropdowns are ellipsised which results in unfathomable branch names.
fields.summary: Make it possible to see long branch names in a pull request
Unable to get diff from Snippets API

fields.description:
I'm created 2 repositories

[https://bitbucket.org/applemint-team/karvan-backup\\
|https://bitbucket.org/applemint-team/karvan-backup]

and

[https://bitbucket.org/applemint-team/karvan-backup2\\
|https://bitbucket.org/applemint-team/karvan-backup2]

I can't destroy them, because, they print "This repository is currently unavailable."

Thank You!
fields.summary: Please, remove 2 mine repo`s
Trying to access the repo with the '.git' on the name will link to the other repo

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Most tools still recognize CR as a line ending sequence.\\
But Bitbucket PR diff recognize it as single line of code with "^M"

h3. Suggested Solution
When trying to display diff in Pull Request, It will be best that Bitbucket replaces the CR with \R or <CR> or &CR; or a warning message that the file contains mixed line endings
fields.summary: Disable TTY handling of CR while rendering diff

fields.description:
I recently closed a pull request that had a branch merged into it.\\
https://bitbucket.org/mnv_tech/synapse-backend/pull-requests/2137

That branch shows up in this pull request. I never merged this one, but it's showing as merged\\
https://bitbucket.org/mnv_tech/synapse-backend/pull-requests/2138
fields.summary: Pull Request Shows as Merged - But Not Merged Manually

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Users unable to use only "#<Numbers>" to refer a PR or an Issue.\\
But instead, users need to enter "pull request #<Numbers>" and "issue #<Numbers>".

h3. Suggested Solution
If PR and Issue are allowed to share the incremental creation number, users will able to use "#<Numbers>" to refer certain PR or Issue.

For an example:

{code}
#!java
BCLOUD-1: issue
BCLOUD-2: issue
BCLOUD-3: PR
BCLOUD-4: issue
BCLOUD-5: PR
{code}

This will allow user to refer the PR by using "#3" instead of "[PR#3|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/pull-requests/3]"
fields.summary: Customer Request: Allow PR and Issue share the incremental creation number

fields.description: If you're adding a single *.ai file, you'll see that the entire binary text is displayed instead of a simple file being added or subtracted. This can cause a headache if you're adding a few *.ai files, which would lock up the pull request due to the number of lines displayed
fields.summary: Adobe Illustrator files will render as binary text in pull request diffs

fields.description:
Hi there,\\
I was struggling with profile images not showing up for my users. And I eventually realized that the problem was Ghostery, preventing gravatar tracking. When ghostery blocks the gravatar tracker - profile avatars show up as a white box, which means they are invisible on most pages.\\
So if you are not seeing images for your members. Check to see if you have a tracker blocker like Ghostery active.\\
Thanks,\\
John Schank
fields.summary: FYI: Gravatar Images, and Ghostery

fields.description: Our team likes to rely on the Activity tab of a Pull Request to see recent activity specific to a single Pull Request. When a comment is made directly on a specific file (but not on any line of the file, just on the file itself) the Activity tab shows the comment with "commented on a file but no context is available" so there is no way to know (without searching for the comment on the Overview tab) which file the comment was made on. Seems like a bug to me... the context should be available. The comment was made in the context of a specific file.
fields.summary: Comments on files within Pull Request show "commented on a file but no context is available" under Activity

fields.description:
I've run into a couple of bizarre issues while reviewing Pull Requests through Chrome on my Mac. 2 functions do not work that I've found so far - deleting comments, and viewing file diffs side by side. For deleting comments, I get the delete window pop up, click "Delete" then nothing happens, the comment is still there. For the diff view, again the pop up appears, but remains blank, no diff view contents.

I don't know if the issues are related, but I do know that they both work in every other scenario I tried: Safari on Mac, Chrome on Windows, and even Chrome on Mac in Incognito mode!

Especially since it worked Incognito, I tried deleting all Chrome browser site data for bitbucket, restarted the browser, but still no luck. I've attached a screen shot of the console error that happens immediately upon hitting the "Delete" button in the delete dialog pop-up. I don't get this error in the console when trying it through the other successful methods above. I suppose the other explanation could be some plug-in conflict, though I have no idea how to verify whether that's the case.

Chrome on Mac is my primary browser, so I'd love to resolve these issues and not have to use an alternative way of browsing BitBucket pull requests.
fields.summary: Certain PullRequest functions not working on Chrome on Mac.

fields.description:
Hello,

I get 500 internal server error when I try to sort tags result by created_on.\\
However I don't get internal server error when I don't include it.

Problem with:\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/appsaloon/mr-wc-integrator-plugin/refs/tags?sort=-created_on

No problem with:\\
https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0/repositories/appsaloon/mr-wc-integrator-plugin/refs/tags

{"error": {"message": "Internal server error", "id": "9e2f0f45d48141c0a8c08870df9b4cff"}}

Take care,

Aytaç
fields.summary: api 2.0 refs/tags sort by created_on causes 500 error

fields.description:
_(Some context: this issue has been originally [raised in standalone Bitbucket|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-9008], but it turned out that it is already fixed there. It's only the cloud Bitbucket that still has the issue.)_

Jira generates branch names using a naming scheme that includes a Jira ID. This is also a common practice anyway, e.g. PROJ-123_fix_bug .

Bitbucket has a feature where it "de-punctuates" the branch name when it places it in pull request titles and descriptions etc.

For example, branch name 'PROJ-123_fix_bug' would be turned into 'Proj 123 fix bug'. This breaks the hyperlinks to tickets.

This is an actual issue in our team because a default value often suggests to users, especially to the new ones, that they should follow it.
fields.summary: Dont break ticket references when auto-generating pull request name from branch name
Unable to change fork_policy via API 2.0

fields.description: Similar to JIRA where users can create an issue branch from a JIRA issue, it'd be great if there's a feature where users can create an issue branch from a Bitbucket issue.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Create branch from Bitbucket's Issues Page.

fields.description:
In the pipelines output, ANSI codes aren't interpreted, so they're rendered as text:

!930838589-output_pipeline.png|thumbnail!

It would be nice for the ANSI codes to be interpreted and text rendered in colour:

!1586552306-output_msysgit.png|thumbnail!

Here's some of the raw output:

{code:bash}

+ for crate in $(ls crate); do rust_build/build.sh "crate/${crate}"; done
\e[1;36m[INFO ] \e[0;36mVerifying source meets code formatting standards\e[0m
\e[1;36m[INFO ] \e[0;36mRunning: ! TERM=dumb cargo fmt -- --config-path="rust_build" --write-mode=diff | grep -e "^\(+\|-\)\|\(Rustfmt failed\)" -m 1 > /dev/null\e[0m
error: 
\e[1;32m[NTICE] \e[0;32mCode format check successful\e[0m
\e[1;36m[INFO ] \e[0;36mCompiling project\e[0m
\e[1;36m[INFO ] \e[0;36mRunning: cargo build\e[0m
(B   Compiling(B rust_runnables v0.1.0 (file:///opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build/crate/rust_runnables)
(B   Compiling(B application v0.1.0 (file:///opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build/crate/application)
\e[1;32m[NTICE] \e[0;32mCompilation successful\e[0m
{code}
fields.summary: Render text using ANSI colour codes

fields.description:
Git users who wish to contribute to a Mercurial project often miss the fact that _hg bookmarks_ are the light-weight equivalent to _git branches_. This confusion is further promoted by the *Branches* link to the left of each repository. This is what bitbucket says:

bq. Creating, working with, and merging branches is easy with Mercurial. If you\\
have work to do,\\
[start with a branch|https://bitbucket.org/eradman/ephemeralpg/branch]


Named branches have a use case of course, but it is not for developing individual features.
fields.summary: Promote the use of bookmarks, not named branches for Mercurial repositories

fields.description:
I'm trying to clone my repo but something goes wrong

Example on my ubuntu server:

oviktor@glexible:/var/www/oviktor/data/www/beta.oviktor.org.ua$ git clone https://Glexible@bitbucket.org/Glexible/ovictor_sym.git .\\
Cloning into '.'...\\
Password for 'https://Glexible@bitbucket.org':\\
error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 0\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
oviktor@glexible:/var/www/oviktor/data/www/beta.oviktor.org.ua$

Example locally:\\
MBP-Aleksej:Projects aglukharev$ git clone https://Glexible@bitbucket.org/Glexible/ovictor_sym.git\\
Cloning into 'ovictor_sym'...\\
error: RPC failed; curl 52 Empty reply from server\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
MBP-Aleksej:Projects aglukharev$

Could you please suggest my anything?
fields.summary: Cannot clone repo: error: RPC failed; result=52, HTTP code = 0

fields.description:
A button in the main bar to show how many pull requests I currently need to review –

In the Bitbucket Server there is a dropdown at the top that I was able to use to see the pull requests that I had to review and the pull requests which I had created. It would be very helpful to have this functionality in Bitbucket Cloud.
fields.summary: UI to Show Number of Pull Requests

fields.description:
Add Keyboard shortcuts to go between files in a diff –

In Bitbucket Server the user is able to use "N", "P", "J", and "K" to go between diffs and files. This is easy to implement and adds a ton of functionality!
fields.summary: Additional navigation keyboard shortcuts in diff view

fields.description:
Add a sidebar with file names in the diff view – In the current Bitbucket Cloud version, you have to scroll the whole way to the top anytime you want to switch between files. This is especially annoying when there are files where only formatting has changed, but you have to scroll through them to go back and forth between two files.

Reference Bitbucket Server for implementation
fields.summary: File List Sidebar in Diff View

fields.description:
To be able to handle unicode characters, I want the default build environment to use a better locale. Right now it uses POSIX, and using en_US.UTF-8 would help.

{code}
#!bash

pipelines:
  branches:
    master:
      - step:
          script:
            - locale

{code}

gives

{code}
#!bash



+ locale
LANG=
LANGUAGE=
LC_CTYPE="POSIX"
LC_NUMERIC="POSIX"
LC_TIME="POSIX"
LC_COLLATE="POSIX"
LC_MONETARY="POSIX"
LC_MESSAGES="POSIX"
LC_PAPER="POSIX"
LC_NAME="POSIX"
LC_ADDRESS="POSIX"
LC_TELEPHONE="POSIX"
LC_MEASUREMENT="POSIX"
LC_IDENTIFICATION="POSIX"
LC_ALL=

{code}

h3. Workarounds
One workaround is to create your own docker image like this\\
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/39140980/how-do-i-create-a-docker-image-for-bitbucket-pipelines

Using a Docker image that can looks something like this:

{code}
#!bash

FROM gcc #Some smart base image
 
# Whatever you need more than what is on the base image required by your project
 
# Set the locale
RUN locale-gen en_US.UTF-8  
ENV LANG en_US.UTF-8  
ENV LANGUAGE en_US:en  
ENV LC_ALL en_US.UTF-8     
{code}

Another even easier workaround is to set these environment variables in your build script or Pipelines settings.
fields.summary: Change Pipelines default image locale to C.UTF-8

fields.description: Add information about how long was executing every command in scenario.
fields.summary: time tracking

fields.description:
Pipelines seems to always clone the source repository to /opt/atlassian/bitbucketci/agent/build.

There are some languages that require a specific directory structure to work, so it would be interesting to be able to specify a checkout folder on bitbucket-pipelines.yml

Right now a few extra steps are needed to create and copy the source to the correct directory.
fields.summary: Allow the location of the clone dir to be configurable

fields.description: When you look at the pr overview screenshot you'll notice that there's no mention of what repository the pull request is for.  I can figure it out, but that's tedious especially since the pull request page already has the repository there.
fields.summary: New pr focused dashboard should display destination repository

fields.description:
I've just started using Pipelines for my personal Perl projects. They all build the same way, so every time I set up Pipelines for another project the UI makes me copy a sample configuration for nothing.

It would be super helpful if one could just reuse another project's bitbucket-pipelines.yml, or even using a snippet as a Pipelines configuration.
fields.summary: Pipelines configuration UI for "Other" needs an option to copy from another project's configuration

fields.description: Like in Bitbucket Server, Cloud version should look at the branch name too to extract ticket-ids for commit or pull requests.
fields.summary: Use Jira's Ticket-id from branch name as Jira link

fields.description:
I'm trying to run my integration tests using pipelines. When running on my local machine they need a fairly constant 2-3 seconds/test case, but when running them on pipelines the deviance is much higher, they need 1-10 seconds to complete.

It wouldn't be disturbing if on every run the same test cases would be slow, but it doesn't really depend on the exact test case how much time it takes for it to pass, So sometimes a test case needs 1,5 seconds, sometimes it needs 9 and it makes finding a proper timeout for the test cases really challenging. It would be nice if during a pipelines run the container got a fairly constant CPU resource, or if it would have been configurable whether I need a constant or a best effort CPU.
fields.summary: Provide a fairly constant CPU and network resource

fields.description:
When i created a new repo and  pushed my project into it, i noticed that the directory "resources" and its child directory "android" were somewhy merged in the path, like this:\\
!896900162-Screenshot%20(61).png|thumbnail!\\
and when i click on it, it takes me to the "android" folder, and the only way to access the "resources" folder is through the bread crumbs nav bar (thanks god there is such an alternative).
fields.summary: Directory name merged a folder to its parent.

fields.description: When I wait for a build to launch (i.e. state is {{Pending}}), a message in the log window stating that Pipelines is waiting for the resources to become available (or similar) would be helpful. Right now there is no indication whether something in the view is broken (e.g. did I loose my internet connection?) or if it's just waiting.
fields.summary: Display informative message while waiting for the build to start

fields.description:
I have a pipeline which performs a build, increments the package version and commits and pushes the result back into the branch.

Currently this would cause an infinite build cycle if i use a single branch.

In other systems, this problem is addressed by including a special tag in the commit message; for example, by including [ci skip] in the commit message.

I am able to do this with two branches but it complicates local workflow and is likely to cause issues.
fields.summary: Disable Pipeline Build Trigger Using Tag in Commit Message (or some other method)

fields.description: Add ability to download all snippets at the click of a button.
fields.summary: Ability to download all snippets at the click of a button - Feature Request

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the past, anyone who commented on a PR was automatically added as a reviewer.\\
This is no longer the case as a user would need to add all the reviewer *manually* to the PR.

h3. Suggested Solution
Auto adds the user as reviewer after commenting in a PR
fields.summary: Customer Request: Auto adds the user as reviewer after commenting in a PR

fields.description: i noticed the button in this picture has a broken link ( see attachment )
fields.summary: Atlassian developer home button not working

fields.description:
The JIRA key auto-link feature in pull request titles is really useful, but often breaks. Not 100% sure of all conditions but it seems if there are any commits without a JIRA prefix (eg. a merge commit), the format breaks.

So instead of "JIRA-123 Fix all the things" you get "Jira 123", even if the branch name is "jira-123" and all non-merge commits have the prefix "JIRA-123".

Even just improving the fallback to keep the linkable format; or use the branch name would be better than the current behaviour.
fields.summary: Buggy JIRA key handling in Pull Request title

fields.description:
Given a team that has a project, there should be a way to retrieve the list of all repositories in that project from the API. I suppose I would expect it to live here (though maybe that doesn't make sense given the fairly 'flat' structure that the api seems to have):\\
https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/teams/%7Bowner%7D/projects/%7Bproject_key%7D

Thanks!
fields.summary: No way to retrieve list of repositories within a project from the api

fields.description:
This isn't an issue per say, but is kind of annoying.  If you have something updating your build status (like pipelines which is where I hit it) and the build status gets set for a merge commit, the build status icon will be grayed out with the rest of the line.

The icon still function fine, it just looks kind of out of place with the other icons, but still it's in place with the rest of the grayed out merge commit.  Not sure which way to go on this, but wanted to bring it up either way.
fields.summary: build indicator is grayed out for merge commits

fields.description:
Hey guys. I just got reinstalled my OS 10.11 and when I was cloning this repo I got this error msg:

{code}
#!git

warning: templates not found /usr/local/git/share/git-core/templates
error: RPC failed; curl 18 transfer closed with outstanding read data remaining
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
fatal: early EOF
fatal: index-pack failed
{code}

I figured it was a slow-network issue, but it wasn't.\\
The repo is still alive since I've checked with my crew.

Thanks for helping me out!
fields.summary: It seems weird because I have fast speed network

fields.description:
Hi All,

I'm Aurelien (Bitbucket Account : TD_ADE). I make the administration for TD_CAT repository (Team : CAT, Project : AD_CDP) and I was planning to modify our repository on Bitbucket as we have nearly a 900 MB repository.

We plan to create others repositories to move some branches in these new repositories. Our actual repository is a little bit special : there no master branch and each branch is independent (no merge).

Anyway, before doing any operation, I made a " git clone " and plan to modify the repository. After this " git clone " command, the size of the repository on Bitbucket website is around 250 MB and not 900 MB like before.

It's like only the main / principal branch is now tracked about the size and not all the branches of the repository. It's very disadvantageous for us as we can't see if there is any effect on our cleaning / moving phase and we are afraid that there is some others problems that we haven't seen yet.

Could you check if this size is reel or if anything change in the size tracking.

Thanks a lot in advance.
fields.summary: Wrong repository size after git clone

fields.description: Add feature to sort repositories by "date created" - an alternative to "last updated" sorting.
fields.summary: Sorting of repositories by "date created" - Feature Request

fields.description:
Make the online editor mobile friendly, currently editing is impossible.

Currently the editor is slow, the line numbers are tiny, the type cursor doesn't work as it should, and cannot even type sometimes!, also zoom levels are off.
fields.summary: Make online editor mobile friendly - Feature Request

fields.description: Add feature to allow sorting of snippets by last modified, name, date/time created.
fields.summary: Snippet Sorting - Feature Request

fields.description:
As we use Pipelines for more and more projects we have more and more builds to monitor. Checking individual repos is not scalable: I want one page to check them all.

E.g. something like the attached image except that each line shows a different repo.
fields.summary: See build status for all repos in my project

fields.description:
The new documentation that was previously rolled out is absolutely horrible. It's navigation is confusing, there is a ton of missing descriptions, and the response bodies don't exist for some endpoints, [commits for example|https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%257Busername%257D/%257Brepo_slug%257D/commit/%257Bsha%257D/comments].

You guys had a functional API document and, for some reason, you pushed into production a significantly worse version of it. Please consider revert those changes or, at the very least, *finishing* the current implementation. Using the [the web archive|https://archive.org/web/] is a crappy work around just to read documentation on your API...
fields.summary: New API v2 Documentation is Horrendous

fields.description:
The ec2 container registry uses an expiring token for {{docker login}} password. The credentials are retrieved using the aws cli and are only valid for 12 hours.

{{aws ecr get-login}}

This forum thread discusses the issue in more detail:\\
https://forums.aws.amazon.com/thread.jspa?messageID=692733
fields.summary: Support for pulling docker image from private AWS ECR

fields.description:
Second time same thing is happening . Have it any permanent solution  ?\\
Please restore ASAP. Our Production is hampering for this.
fields.summary: no user is showing in Repository access management and can't give access permission

fields.description:
By default, Connect add-ons are assigned the "Charlie puzzle piece" icon in the "Manage add-ons" page, as shown here for the "Label-It" add-on:

!4249576611-manage-add-ons.png|thumbnail!

Add-ons could brand themselves more effectively if they were allowed to specify an icon URL in their JSON descriptor, alongside the {{name}} and {{description}} fields, for example.

In the meantime, IIUC, add-on developers can only have an icon if it's explicitly added by the Bitbucket team, as was done for the Aerobatic and [Pipelines|https://extranet.atlassian.com/jira/browse/BBCI-1691] add-ons in this screenshot. This approach is inconvenient for both parties.

_Meta: there doesn't seem to be a "Component" in this issue tracker for things related to Connect._
fields.summary: Allow Connect add-ons to specify an icon in the descriptor

fields.description:
There's 2 different issues wrapped up in this one bug. When you click "Stop" to terminate a pipeline:

* The UI is immediately updated to a stopped state, although the pipeline continues for some time.
* Log results of the pipeline are no longer collected, further suggesting the pipeline is stopped (but might still be running)
fields.summary: stopping a pipeline does not immediately stop the execution of the pipeline

fields.description:
I created a private repo for a project I'm developing on BitBucket, but I'm having issues adding an initial commit using command line.

I typed in git push -u origin --all and got the following error message:

Permission denied (publickey).\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights\\
and the repository exists.
fields.summary: permission denied (public key)

fields.description: We have been evaluating Pipelines since Bamboo is being EOL.  Accessing external git repositories is something we currently use in bamboo and we have many source code repositories hosted at github.  If this functionality is not planned then we will likely have to find a different CI tool.
fields.summary: Support for external git repositories

fields.description:
Hello there I have the exact same problem than Christian in the Issue BCLOUD-7441 (Adding the "one too much" user to your account can kill everyones access), the issue is tagged resolved and staff said that cannot happen anymore, but we are in that situation we cannot push on repository we get this error : "remote: abort: the account owner has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository."  When I try to change rights access I get "Technical Error" and being asked to try later.  Please help.

Thank you
fields.summary: the account owner has exceeded their user limit - write access is disabled to the repository.

fields.description:
# U2F is not a sub-part of smartphone-based 2FA - it's an independent method, and should have the same level as smartphone-based 2FA. I should be able to enable 2FA using _only_ U2F as my second factor (no smartphone-based access), and receive recovery codes via email (and be able to access them via SSH).
# There must be a way to use recovery code(s) on a U2F-enabled account _regardless_ of whether a smartphone-based 2FA was or was not enabled.

Let me add an insult - your current design where U2F can only be enabled if smartphone-based 2FA has already been set up is _stupid_.
fields.summary: Add ability to set U2F without smartphone, and use recovery codes to U2F

fields.description:
Repositories often contain sensitive data which reflects internal company processes and other secrets which should not be - or are not legally allowed to be - public. There are use-cases where a company might not want any of their BitBucket repositories to be public, ever.

Please add a feature to allow an organisation to permanently disallow/disable the creation of public repositories. This will prevent accidental public repositories which can easily happen for a variety of human reasons.

That is, add a feature which when activated disables the following: the ability to select 'public' for repository visibility on repository creation, and the same in the repository settings page for existing repositories.
fields.summary: Security issue: Allow an organisation to disable public repositories.

fields.description:
Almost a year ago Marcus Bertrand (A Bitbucket employee) reached out to me, and I'm sure to other 3rd party developers, and strongly suggested that I move to OAuth authentication over basic as that was going away. Great. Unfortunately, because HTTP GET a repository avatars requires authentication, and because "OAuth is not supported for this endpoint" (the response from the Bitbucket API) it makes getting the avatar impossible. The only way you could access the avatar is with BASIC authentication.

Please, for the love of god, make token authentication uniform across your platform. It makes no sense to have some only available from BASIC and suggest to your users that you switch to OAuth.
fields.summary: Unable to access repository avatars without BASIC Auth

fields.description:
I use git as part of my build & deployment process.  Part of the build stage involves the generation and subsequent commit of two large files, the various versions of which were taking up repo space and pushing against the 2GB limit for Bitbucket repos.  This seemed like an ideal use case for the new git LFS feature, which I implemented this morning.

The build-stage push to Bitbucket seems to be working fine; I can see these files in the Git LFS section of my repo settings.  However, I encounter a problem in the deployment stage.  After checking out the appropriate tag, I attempt to use {{git lfs fetch}} and get the following output:

{code}
Fetching HEAD
Git LFS: (0 of 2 files) 0 B / 17.11 MB
exit status 1
Warning: errors occurred
{code}

With no further information available and no helpful information resulting from my google searches, I have to assume that this is a bug in the beta LFS feature in Bitbucket.  I'm going to be rolling back my LFS implementation to unblock my build & deployment process, but I'd appreciate if somebody could investigate and explain in more detail what this error means and how to address it.

Thanks for any help you can provide.
fields.summary: Support deployment keys with Git LFS

fields.description:
Unable to delete a repository as it just says "Repository Unavailable".

We are reorganizing how we structure our projects and teams and this bad project is the only project attached to a project we are looking to remove.

If you could be so kind as to remove https://bitbucket.org/avocetsys/bol_upload that would be fantastic.
fields.summary: Repository Unavailable

fields.description:
It would be nice if the user has an option to change the naming convention of zip files uploaded to S3 when using the "Deploy to AWS" link in Bitbucket.

But if this is not possible maybe at least an option to append to the filename will help. Like adding a release version number per zip file.
fields.summary: CodeDeploy: Change in Naming Convention of Zip files uploaded to S3

fields.description: Not able to push,pull , clone the repo. getting network error.
fields.summary: Connection Timeout issue from Ubuntu

fields.description:
Would it be possible to implement a feature where you could create a custom CSS file for READMEs to use?

The current CSS slapped on READMEs is not as good as it could be (IMO) and custom CSS as an option could offload upkeeping a global CSS for them by the Bitbucket team.
fields.summary: Custom README CSS

fields.description:
I'm not able to give access to any user and view any user/group list on repository access management page.\\
Doesn't fetch any user list and shows its loading.
fields.summary: Javascript in repository settings caused some features to stop working

fields.description: fatal: unable to access 'https://marktacatani@bitbucket.org/.../....git/': Failed to connect to bitbucket.org port 443: No route to host
fields.summary: No route to host

fields.description:
I wonder what stops filtering Commits resource

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/resource/repositories/%7Busername%7D/%7Brepo_slug%7D/commits

similar to others?

https://developer.atlassian.com/bitbucket/api/2/reference/meta/filtering

It is a big hurdle for us because we need to pull down a lot of commits for a given date range and forced to get all existing commits in order to subsequently filter them on our side.

This is very inefficient and often results in HTTP 429 (Too many requests)
fields.summary: Add filtering and sorting to commits resource

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When attempting to change the source branch which is removed, the source branch selection dropdown doesn't have any branches to choose from, and the loading animation is being shown indefinitely.

h3. Suggested Solution
It will be best to have a warning like "Source branch doesn't exist" instead of showing a loading animation.
fields.summary: Show error message in Pull Request when Source Branch doesn't exist (BB-16185)

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Text input 'space' key does not work well on Source Editor page with Android Device (Chrome).\\
After tapping 'space', the editor auto remove the 'space'.

*Image: Expected Result 1.gif*

After disabled the keyboard _Predictive Text_ function, it able to perform 'Space' but auto performs spacing then replace with the first character of line after another 'space'.

*Image: Expected Result 2.gif*

h3. Environment
* Android 6
* Chrome Browser
fields.summary: 'Space' key does not work well on Source Editor page with Android Device (BB-16184)

fields.description:
When creating/editing issue or leaving comment we see 'description' field. This field markdowns have these bugs: [*New line(enter button)*] does nothing - saved text always is in one line, this makes another bug: 'Bulleted list' doesn't work as should - this just writes every element in one line, and makes some of them 'italic'. Here is an example:

* first line
* second line
* third line
fields.summary: Some markdowns doesn't work as should in issue creating

fields.description:
As I understand priority must sort like this:\\
*Blocker -> Critical -> Major -> Trivial -> Minor* being 'Blocker' the highest priority and 'Minor' the lowest one, now it works like this:\\
*Trivial -> Minor -> Major -> Critical -> Blocker* ('Trivial' is highest and 'Blocker' is lowest)
fields.summary: Incorrect priority sorting in issue tracker

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When users view a repository they have already forked, they can view the list of all forks (they have access to) in Overview page, by clicking the number of Forks there:\\
!3272706976-Screen%20Shot%202016-07-19%20at%2010.15.38.png|thumbnail!

However, if many other users have forked this repo as well, the list may be long; the user will have to scroll down that list to find it out, it's not visible at first glance whether the user has already a fork of the repo.

h3. Suggested Solution
When a user navigates to the Overview page of a repository they have forked, show a separate list of all forks this user has made from this repo.

E.g. in the forked repo, there is already a link of the original repo:\\
!3530285884-Screen%20Shot%202016-07-19%20at%2010.16.18.png|thumbnail!

The suggestion is to include a similar link/list in the original repo, showing 'My forks: <list of forks>'
fields.summary: Customer request - As a repo admin I want to see a list of my forks only, when I view a repo I have forked

fields.description:
Users should be prompted with a warning message, and an explicit notification and direct question before the allowing users to import issues, example:

Do you want really lost all current data and replace it with the import? Yes/No

This is better than a generic message in the import/export panel.
fields.summary: Customer Request: Have a clearer warning message before importing issues, notifying that previous data will be replaced

fields.description: I'm realize CI with pipelines for my C# project. If you are interested I can provide scripts of built .NET app with mono docker and deploy to yandex disk.
fields.summary: Add example of CI project for .NET

fields.description:
I have internal bitbucket and whenever I try to generate a clone link for ssh it is created wrong:

This is the link that gets generated:\\
{{ssh://git@192.168.5.15:7999/aut/az_terraform.git}}

Which doesn't work and I get this error:

{code}
[jenkins@jenkins1 test]$ git clone ssh://git@192.168.5.15:7999/aut/az_terraform.git
Cloning into 'az_terraform'...
ssh: connect to host 192.168.5.15 port 7999: No route to host
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Even though the repo is public.

I can only clone and push via http which is:\\
{{http://jenkins@192.168.5.15:7990/scm/aut/az_terraform.git}}

This is what happens when I try to test my ssh connection to my internal bitbucket with my service user:

{code}
#!bash

[jenkins@jenkins1 az_terraform]$ ssh -T -v -i ~/.ssh/bitbucketinternal jenkins@192.168.5.15
OpenSSH_6.6.1, OpenSSL 1.0.1e-fips 11 Feb 2013
debug1: Reading configuration data /home/jenkins/.ssh/config
debug1: /home/jenkins/.ssh/config line 1: Applying options for 192.168.5.15
debug1: Reading configuration data /etc/ssh/ssh_config
debug1: /etc/ssh/ssh_config line 55: Applying options for *
debug1: Connecting to 192.168.5.15 [192.168.5.15] port 7990.
debug1: Connection established.
debug1: identity file /home/jenkins/.ssh/bitbucketinternal type 1
debug1: identity file /home/jenkins/.ssh/bitbucketinternal-cert type -1
debug1: identity file /home/jenkins/.ssh/bitbucketinternal type 1
debug1: identity file /home/jenkins/.ssh/bitbucketinternal-cert type -1
debug1: Enabling compatibility mode for protocol 2.0
debug1: Local version string SSH-2.0-OpenSSH_6.6.1
debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: Server: Apache-Coyote/1.1


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: Transfer-Encoding: chunked


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: Date: Mon, 18 Jul 2016 21:57:59 GMT


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: Connection: close


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification:


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification: 0


debug1: ssh_exchange_identification:


ssh_exchange_identification: Connection closed by remote host
{code}

If I try to push, I immediately get a password prompt for my jenkins user. The jenkins user has a valid key, it's uploaded to bitbucket, it's loaded on the source machine. I'm using the latest bitbucket version.
fields.summary: ssh links not generating correctly and ssh does not work for a user

fields.description:
Some users have reported issues when cloning/pulling/pushing via SSH.

These operations sometimes fail with error:

'Connection closed by 104.192.143.1'\\
or

'Connection to git@bitbucket.org:22 exited: Remote closed the connection\\
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.'

We are currently investigating this as a bug.
fields.summary: Intermittent SSH errors - 'Connection closed by 104.192.143.1' (BBCDEV-1775)

*Steps to reproduce:*

Trying to create an app password without Pipelines permissions will work fine though.

Something like this:\\
http://i.imgur.com/mBxF2Bd.png

fields.description: I am migrating trepositories from a nother place and am writing a script to accomplish this task. So, i am testing a couple functions and that is causing me to have a lot of api calls. could this be the cause of the 403 error.
fields.summary: Getting a 403 HTTP response when making API calls.

fields.description:
From a CI perspective it would help a lot to simply get a list of the Files Changed from a Pull request using the API.

Currently there doesn't seem to be a good work around. I can get all commits and then use the changeset from the v1.0 API but this will result in seeing files that were changed then reverted(would not show as changed in the pull request).

The other option I've been thinking about is using the pullrequest /diff API. But that just dumps back the entire change - unreasonable in large PRs. It also just returns as text rather then something usable (JSON).

If you look at a pull request in the browser there is a list of Files Changed (with add/removed numbers and number of comments). There needs to be a way to get this list through the API.
fields.summary: API to get list of changed files in a Pull Request

fields.description: Update -- This feature has been launched to allow reviewers to mark a  pull request as "Requests Changes." This also allows customers to set up merge checks that block the merge of PRs until this status has been cleared by reviewers. As part of this work, we also moved the reviewers over into a sidebar so that it is easier to see which reviewers have indicated particular statuses. See screenshot below of attached functionality.
fields.summary: "Needs work" reviewer status
